Definition.WordDefinition: Hooker, OK (city, FIPS 36000) Location: 36.85991 N, 101.21196 W Population (1990): 1551 (742 housing units) Area: 2.4 sq km (land), 0.0 sq km (water)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hooker \Hook"er\, n. 1. One who, or that which, hooks. [1913 Webster]
2. (Naut.) (a) A Dutch vessel with two masts. (b) A fishing boat with one mast, used on the coast of Ireland. (c) A sailor's contemptuous term for any antiquated craft. [1913 Webster]

Hooker n 1: United States general in the Union Army who was defeated at Chancellorsville by Robert E. Lee (1814-1879) [syn: {Joseph Hooker}, {Fighting Joe Hooker}] 2: English theologian (1554-1600) [syn: {Richard Hooker}] 3: a prostitute who attracts customers by walking the streets [syn: {streetwalker}, {street girl}, {hustler}, {floozy}, {floozie}, {slattern}] 4: a golfer whose shots typically curve left (for right-handed golfers) 5: (rugby) the player in the middle of the front row of the scrum who tries to capture the ball with the foot
